pli-tv-kd18:1.1.3: A certain newly arrived monk unlocked the bolt of an unoccupied dwelling, opened the door, and entered hastily.

pli-tv-kd18:6.1.2: They did not set out water for drinking or water for washing; they did not light fires or provide upper and lower fire sticks; and they did not know the constellations or the cardinal directions.

pli-tv-kd18:7.1.0: Discussion of the proper conduct in regard to dwellings
pli-tv-kd18:7.1.1: On one occasion when a number of monks were making robes outside,
pli-tv-kd18:7.1.2: the monks from the group of six were beating furniture in an open space upwind from them.
pli-tv-kd18:7.1.4: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-kd18:7.1.5: “How can the monks from the group of six do this?”
pli-tv-kd18:7.1.7: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
pli-tv-kd18:7.1.8: “Is it true, monks, that the monks from the group of six did this?”
pli-tv-kd18:7.1.11: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-kd18:7.1.12: “Well then, I will lay down the proper conduct in regard to dwellings.
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.1: If the dwelling he is staying in is dirty, a monk should clean it if he is able.
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.2: When he is cleaning the dwelling, he should first take out the bowl and robe and put them aside.
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.3: He should take out the sitting mat and the sheet and put them aside.
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.4: He should take out the mattress and the pillow and put them aside.
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.5: Holding the bed low, he should carefully take it out without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it aside.
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.6: Holding the bench low, he should carefully take it out without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it aside.
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.7: He should take out the bed supports and put them aside.
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.8: He should take out the spittoon and put it aside.
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.9: He should take out the leaning board and put it aside.
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.10: After taking note of where it’s placed, he should take out the floor-cover and put it aside.
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.11: If the dwelling has cobwebs, he should first remove them from the ceiling cloth, and he should then wipe the windows and the corners of the room.
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.12: If the walls have been treated with red ocher and they’re moldy, he should moisten a cloth, wring it out, and wipe the walls.
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.13: If the floor has been treated with black and it’s moldy, he should moisten a cloth, wring it out, and wipe the floor.
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.14: If the floor is untreated, he should sprinkle it with water and then sweep it,
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.15: while trying to avoid stirring up dust.
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.16: He should look out for any trash and discard it.
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.17: He should not beat the furniture near other monks,
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.21: He should not beat the furniture in an open area upwind from these things,
pli-tv-kd18:7.3.1: He should sun the floor-cover, clean it, beat it, bring it back inside, and put it back in the same place as before.
pli-tv-kd18:7.3.2: He should sun the bed supports, wipe them, bring them back inside, and place them in the same position as before.
pli-tv-kd18:7.3.3: He should sun the bed, clean it, and beat it. Holding it low, he should carefully bring it back inside without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it back in the same place as before.
pli-tv-kd18:7.3.4: He should sun the bench, clean it, and beat it. Holding it low, he should carefully bring it back inside without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it back in the same place as before.
pli-tv-kd18:7.3.5: He should sun the mattress and the pillow, clean them, beat them, bring them back inside, and put them back the way they were.
pli-tv-kd18:7.3.6: He should sun the sitting mat and the sheet, clean them, beat them, bring them back inside, and put them back the way they were.
pli-tv-kd18:7.3.7: He should sun the spittoon, wipe it, bring it back inside, and put it back where it was.
pli-tv-kd18:7.3.8: He should sun the leaning board, wipe it, bring it back inside, and put it back where it was.
pli-tv-kd18:7.3.9: He should put away the bowl and robe.
pli-tv-kd18:7.3.10: When putting away the bowl, he should hold the bowl in one hand, feel under the bed or the bench with the other, and then put it away.
pli-tv-kd18:7.3.11: He should not put away the bowl on the bare ground.
pli-tv-kd18:7.3.12: When putting away the robe, he should hold the robe in one hand, wipe the bamboo robe-rack or the clothesline with the other, and then put it away by folding the robe over it, making the ends face the wall and the fold face out.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.1: If dusty winds are blowing from the east, he should close the windows on the eastern side.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.2: If dusty winds are blowing from the west, he should close the windows on the western side.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.3: If dusty winds are blowing from the north, he should close the windows on the northern side.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.4: If dusty winds are blowing from the south, he should close the windows on the southern side.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.5: If the weather is cold, he should open the windows during the day and close them at night.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.6: If the weather is hot, he should close the windows during the day and open them at night.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.7: If the precincts are dirty, he should sweep them.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.8: If the gateway is dirty, he should sweep it.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.9: If the assembly hall is dirty, he should sweep it.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.10: If the water-boiling shed is dirty, he should sweep it.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.11: If the restroom is dirty, he should sweep it.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.12: If there is no water for drinking, he should set it out.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.13: If there is no water for washing, he should set it out.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.14: If there is no water in the rinsing pot, he should fill it.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.15: If he is staying in the same dwelling as a more senior monk, he should not do any of the following without asking him for permission: recite, question, rehearse, teach, turn a lamp on or off, or open or close a window.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.16: If he is walking up and down on a walking-path together with a more senior monk, he should walk behind him, but he should not hit him with the corners of his robe.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.17: This is the proper conduct in regard to dwellings.”
pli-tv-kd18:8.1.0: Discussion of the proper conduct in regard to saunas
pli-tv-kd18:8.1.1: On one occasion the monks from the group of six were kept out of the sauna by the senior monks. Then, out of disrespect, they stacked up much firewood, lit it, closed the door, and sat down against it.
pli-tv-kd18:8.1.2: The monks overheated, but being unable to open the door, they fainted and collapsed.
pli-tv-kd18:8.1.3: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-kd18:8.1.4: “How can the monks from the group of six do this?”
pli-tv-kd18:8.1.6: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
pli-tv-kd18:8.1.7: “Is it true, monks, that the monks from the group of six did this?”
pli-tv-kd18:8.1.11: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-kd18:8.1.12: “If you’re kept out of a sauna by senior monks, you should not, out of disrespect, stack up much firewood and light it.
pli-tv-kd18:8.1.13: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-kd18:8.1.14: And you should not close the door and sit down against it.
pli-tv-kd18:8.1.15: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.1: Well then, I will lay down the proper conduct in regard to saunas.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.2: The monk who goes first to the sauna should discard the ashes if they are building up.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.3: If the sauna is dirty, he should sweep it.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.4: If the area immediately outside the sauna is dirty, he should sweep it.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.5: If the precincts are dirty, he should sweep them.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.6: If the gateway is dirty, he should sweep it.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.7: If the sauna shed is dirty, he should sweep it.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.8: He should knead bath powder, moisten the clay, and fill the water trough with water.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.9: When entering the sauna, he should smear his face with clay, cover himself in front and behind, and then enter the sauna.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.10: He shouldn’t sit encroaching on the senior monks,
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.11: and he shouldn’t block the junior monks from getting a seat.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.12: If he is able, he should do services for the senior monks in the sauna.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.13: When leaving the sauna, he should take the sauna stool, cover himself in front and behind, and then leave the sauna.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.14: If he is able, he should also do services for the senior monks in the water.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.15: He should not bathe in front of the senior monks or upstream from them.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.16: When he is coming out of the water after bathing, he should give way to those who are entering the water.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.17: If the sauna is muddy, the last monk to leave it should wash it.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.18: He should wash the clay trough, put away the sauna stool, extinguish the fire, close the door, and then depart.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.19: This is the proper conduct in regard to saunas.”
pli-tv-kd18:9.1.0: Discussion of the proper conduct in regard to restrooms
pli-tv-kd18:9.1.1: At that time a monk who had been born as a brahmin did not want to rinse after defecating, thinking,
pli-tv-kd18:9.1.2: “Who would touch this foul, stinking stuff?”
pli-tv-kd18:9.1.3: As a result, a worm settled in his anus.
pli-tv-kd18:9.1.4: He told the monks, who said,
pli-tv-kd18:9.1.7: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,
pli-tv-kd18:9.1.8: “How can a monk not rinse after defecating?”
pli-tv-kd18:9.1.9: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
pli-tv-kd18:9.1.10: “Is it true, monk, that you don’t rinse after defecating?”
pli-tv-kd18:9.1.13: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-kd18:9.1.14: “When there is water available, you should rinse after defecating.
pli-tv-kd18:9.1.15: If you don’t, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
pli-tv-kd18:10.1.1: At that time the monks used the restroom according to seniority.
pli-tv-kd18:10.1.2: Junior monks who had arrived before others had to wait to defecate.
pli-tv-kd18:10.1.3: Holding it in, they fainted and collapsed.
pli-tv-kd18:10.1.4: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
pli-tv-kd18:10.1.5: “Is it true, monks, that this is happening?”
pli-tv-kd18:10.1.6: “It’s true, Sir.” … and the Buddha addressed the monks:
pli-tv-kd18:10.1.7: “The restroom should not be used according to seniority.
pli-tv-kd18:10.1.8: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-kd18:10.1.9: You should use the restroom according to the order of arrival.”
pli-tv-kd18:10.2.1: At that time the monks from the group of six entered the restroom too hastily, pulled up their robe before entering, groaned while defecating, brushed their teeth while defecating, defecated outside the toilet, urinated outside the urinal, spat in the urinal, used coarse wiping sticks, threw the wiping sticks in the cesspit, left the restroom too hastily, came out with their robe still pulled up, made a chomping sound while rinsing, and they left water in the scoop for rinsing.
pli-tv-kd18:10.2.2: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-kd18:10.2.3: “How can the monks from the group of six act like this?”
pli-tv-kd18:10.2.4: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
pli-tv-kd18:10.2.5: “Is it true, monks, that the monks from the group of six act like this?”
pli-tv-kd18:10.2.8: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-kd18:10.2.9: “Well then, I will lay down the proper conduct in regard to restrooms.
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.1: When a monk goes to the restroom, he should stand outside and clear his throat.
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.2: Anyone sitting inside should also clear his throat.
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.3: After hanging his robe from a bamboo robe-rack or a clothesline, he should enter the restroom carefully and without hurry.
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.4: He should not enter the restroom too hastily;
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.5: he should not pull up his robe before he has entered;
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.6: he should pull up his robe when he is standing on the foot-stands for defecating;
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.7: he should not groan while defecating;
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.8: he should not brush his teeth while defecating;
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.9: he should not defecate outside the toilet;
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.10: he should not urinate outside the urinal;
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.11: he should not spit in the urinal;
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.12: he should not use coarse wiping sticks;
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.13: he should not throw the wiping sticks in the cesspit;
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.14: he should cover himself while still standing on the foot-stands for defecating;
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.15: he should not leave the restroom too hastily;
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.16: he should not come out with his robe still pulled up;
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.17: he should pull up his robe when standing on the foot-stands for rinsing;
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.18: he should not make a chomping sound while rinsing;
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.19: he should not leave water in the scoop for rinsing;
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.20: he should cover himself while still standing on the foot-stands for rinsing.
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.21: If the restroom is stained by feces, he should clean it.
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.22: If the wiping-stick receptacle is full, he should discard the wiping sticks.
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.23: If the restroom is dirty, he should sweep it.
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.24: If the area immediately outside the restroom is dirty, he should sweep it.
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.25: If the precincts are dirty, he should sweep them.
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.26: If the gateway is dirty, he should sweep it.
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.27: If there is no water in the pot for rinsing water, he should fill it.
pli-tv-kd18:10.3.28: This is the proper conduct in regard to restrooms.”
pli-tv-kd18:11.1.0: Discussion of the proper conduct toward a preceptor
pli-tv-kd18:11.1.1: At that time the students were not conducting themselves properly toward their preceptors.
pli-tv-kd18:11.1.2: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-kd18:11.1.3: “How can the students not conduct themselves properly toward their preceptors?”
pli-tv-kd18:11.1.4: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
pli-tv-kd18:11.1.5: “Is it true, monks, that the students are not conducting themselves properly toward their preceptors?”
pli-tv-kd18:11.1.8: “… How can they act like this?
pli-tv-kd18:11.1.9: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …”
pli-tv-kd18:11.1.11: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-kd18:11.1.12: “Well then, I will lay down the proper conduct for a student toward his preceptor
pli-tv-kd18:11.2.1: A student should conduct himself properly toward his preceptor.
pli-tv-kd18:11.2.3: After getting up at the appropriate time, the student should take off his sandals and put his upper robe over one shoulder. He should then give his preceptor a toothbrush and water for rinsing the mouth, and he should prepare a seat for him.
pli-tv-kd18:11.2.4: If there is rice porridge, he should wash a vessel and bring the rice porridge to his preceptor.
pli-tv-kd18:11.2.5: When the preceptor has drunk the rice porridge, the student should give him water and receive the vessel, and holding it low, he should wash it carefully without scratching it and then put it away.
pli-tv-kd18:11.2.6: When the preceptor has gotten up, the student should put away the seat.
pli-tv-kd18:11.2.7: If the place is dirty, he should sweep it.
pli-tv-kd18:11.3.1: If the preceptor wants to enter the village, the student should give him a sarong and receive the one he’s wearing in return. He should give him a belt. He should put the upper robes together, overlapping each other edge-to-edge, and then give them to him. He should wash his preceptor’s bowl and then give it to him while wet.
pli-tv-kd18:11.3.2: If the preceptor wants an attendant, the student should put on his sarong evenly all around, covering the navel and the knees. He should put on a belt. Putting the other upper together, overlapping each other edge-to-edge, he should put them on and fasten the toggle. After washing his bowl, he should take it with him and be his preceptor’s attendant.
pli-tv-kd18:11.3.3: He shouldn’t walk too far behind his preceptor or too close to him. He should receive the contents of his bowl.
pli-tv-kd18:11.4.1: He shouldn’t interrupt his preceptor when he’s speaking.
pli-tv-kd18:11.4.2: But if the preceptor’s speech is bordering on an offense, he should stop him.
pli-tv-kd18:11.4.3: When returning, the student should go first to prepare a seat and to set out a foot-stool, a foot-scraper, and water for washing the feet. He should go out to meet the preceptor to receive his bowl and robe. He should give him a sarong and receive the one he’s wearing in return.
pli-tv-kd18:11.4.4: If the robe is moist, he should sun it for a short while, but he shouldn’t leave it in the heat.
pli-tv-kd18:11.4.6: offsetting the edges by seven centimeters,
pli-tv-kd18:11.4.7: so that the fold doesn’t become worn.
pli-tv-kd18:11.4.8: He should place the belt in the fold.
pli-tv-kd18:11.4.9: If there is almsfood and his preceptor wants to eat, the student should give him water and then the almsfood.
pli-tv-kd18:11.5.1: He should ask his preceptor if he wants water to drink.
pli-tv-kd18:11.5.2: When the preceptor has eaten, the student should give him water and receive the bowl, and holding it low, he should wash it carefully without scratching it. He should then dry it and sun it for a short while,
pli-tv-kd18:11.5.3: but he shouldn’t leave it in the heat.
pli-tv-kd18:11.5.4: The student should put away the robe and bowl.
pli-tv-kd18:11.5.5: When putting away the bowl, he should hold the bowl in one hand, feel under the bed or the bench with the other, and then put it away.
pli-tv-kd18:11.5.6: He should not put away the bowl on the bare ground.
pli-tv-kd18:11.5.7: When putting away the robe, he should hold the robe in one hand, wipe the bamboo robe-rack or the clothesline with the other, and then put it away by folding the robe over it, making the ends face the wall and the fold face out.
pli-tv-kd18:11.5.8: When the preceptor has gotten up, the student should put away the seat and also the foot-stool, the foot-scraper, and the water for washing the feet.
pli-tv-kd18:11.5.9: If the place is dirty, he should sweep it.
pli-tv-kd18:11.6.1: “If the preceptor wants to bathe, the student should prepare the bath.
pli-tv-kd18:11.6.2: If he wants a cold bath, he should prepare that;
pli-tv-kd18:11.6.3: if he wants a hot bath, he should prepare that.
pli-tv-kd18:11.6.4: If the preceptor wants to use the sauna, the student should knead bath powder, moisten the clay, take the sauna stool, and follow behind his preceptor. After giving the preceptor the sauna stool, receiving his robe, and putting it aside, he should give him the bath powder and the clay.
pli-tv-kd18:11.6.5: If he’s able, he should enter the sauna.
pli-tv-kd18:11.6.6: When entering the sauna, he should smear his face with clay, cover himself in front and behind, and then enter the sauna.
pli-tv-kd18:11.7.1: He shouldn’t sit encroaching on the senior monks,
pli-tv-kd18:11.7.2: and he shouldn’t block the junior monks from getting a seat.
pli-tv-kd18:11.7.3: While in the sauna, he should do services for his preceptor.
pli-tv-kd18:11.7.4: When leaving the sauna, he should take the sauna stool, cover himself in front and behind, and then leave the sauna.
pli-tv-kd18:11.7.5: He should also do services for his preceptor in the water.
pli-tv-kd18:11.7.6: When he has bathed, he should be the first to come out of the water. He should dry himself and put on his sarong. He should then wipe the water off his preceptor’s body, and he should give him his sarong and then his upper robe. Taking the sauna stool, he should be the first to return. He should prepare a seat, as well as set out a foot-stool, a foot-scraper, and water for washing the feet.
pli-tv-kd18:11.7.7: He should ask his preceptor if he wants water to drink.
pli-tv-kd18:11.8.1: If the preceptor wants him to recite, he should do so.
pli-tv-kd18:11.8.2: If the preceptor wants to question him, he should be questioned.
pli-tv-kd18:11.8.3: “If the dwelling where the preceptor is staying is dirty, the student should clean it if he’s able.
pli-tv-kd18:11.8.4: When he’s cleaning the dwelling, he should first take out the bowl and robe and put them aside.
pli-tv-kd18:11.8.5: He should take out the sitting mat and the sheet and put them aside.
pli-tv-kd18:11.8.6: He should take out the mattress and the pillow and put them aside.
pli-tv-kd18:11.9.1: Holding the bed low, he should carefully take it out without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it aside.
pli-tv-kd18:11.9.2: Holding the bench low, he should carefully take it out without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it aside.
pli-tv-kd18:11.9.3: He should take out the bed supports and put them aside.
pli-tv-kd18:11.9.4: He should take out the spittoon and put it aside.
pli-tv-kd18:11.9.5: He should take out the leaning board and put it aside.
pli-tv-kd18:11.9.6: After taking note of where it’s placed, he should take out the floor cover and put it aside.
pli-tv-kd18:11.9.7: If the dwelling has cobwebs, he should first remove them from the ceiling cloth, and he should then wipe the windows and the corners of the room.
pli-tv-kd18:11.9.8: If the walls have been treated with red ocher and they’re moldy, he should moisten a cloth, wring it out, and wipe the walls.
pli-tv-kd18:11.9.9: If the floor has been treated with black and it’s moldy, he should moisten a cloth, wring it out, and wipe the floor.
pli-tv-kd18:11.9.10: If the floor is untreated, he should sprinkle it with water and then sweep it,
pli-tv-kd18:11.9.11: while trying to avoid stirring up dust.
pli-tv-kd18:11.9.12: He should look out for any trash and discard it.
pli-tv-kd18:11.10.1: He should sun the floor cover, clean it, beat it, bring it back inside, and put it back in the same place as before.
pli-tv-kd18:11.10.2: He should sun the bed supports, wipe them, bring them back inside, and place them in the same position as before.
pli-tv-kd18:11.10.3: He should sun the bed, clean it, and beat it. Holding it low, he should carefully bring it back inside without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it back in the same place as before.
pli-tv-kd18:11.10.4: He should sun the bench, clean it, and beat it. Holding it low, he should carefully bring it back inside without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it back in the same place as before.
pli-tv-kd18:11.10.5: He should sun the mattress and the pillow, clean them, beat them, bring them back inside, and put them back the way they were.
pli-tv-kd18:11.10.6: He should sun the sitting mat and the sheet, clean them, beat them, bring them back inside, and put them back the way they were.
pli-tv-kd18:11.10.7: He should sun the spittoon, wipe it, bring it back inside, and put it back where it was.
pli-tv-kd18:11.10.8: He should sun the leaning board, wipe it, bring it back inside, and put it back where it was.
pli-tv-kd18:11.11.1: He should put away the bowl and robe.
pli-tv-kd18:11.11.2: When putting away the bowl, he should hold the bowl in one hand, feel under the bed or the bench with the other, and then put it away.
pli-tv-kd18:11.11.3: He should not put away the bowl on the bare ground.
pli-tv-kd18:11.11.4: When putting away the robe, he should hold the robe in one hand, wipe the bamboo robe-rack or the clothesline with the other, and then put it away by folding the robe over it, making the ends face the wall and the fold face out.
pli-tv-kd18:11.12.1: If dusty winds are blowing from the east, he should close the windows on the eastern side.
pli-tv-kd18:11.12.2: If dusty winds are blowing from the west, he should close the windows on the western side.
pli-tv-kd18:11.12.3: If dusty winds are blowing from the north, he should close the windows on the northern side.
pli-tv-kd18:11.12.4: If dusty winds are blowing from the south, he should close the windows on the southern side.
pli-tv-kd18:11.12.5: If the weather is cold, he should open the windows during the day and close them at night.
pli-tv-kd18:11.12.6: If the weather is hot, he should close the windows during the day and open them at night.
pli-tv-kd18:11.13.1: If the precincts are dirty, he should sweep them.
pli-tv-kd18:11.13.2: If the gateway is dirty, he should sweep it.
pli-tv-kd18:11.13.3: If the assembly hall is dirty, he should sweep it.
pli-tv-kd18:11.13.4: If the water-boiling shed is dirty, he should sweep it.
pli-tv-kd18:11.13.5: If the restroom is dirty, he should sweep it.
pli-tv-kd18:11.13.6: If there is no water for drinking, he should set it out.
pli-tv-kd18:11.13.7: If there is no water for washing, he should set it out.
pli-tv-kd18:11.13.8: If there is no water in the rinsing pot, he should fill it.
pli-tv-kd18:11.14.1: “If the preceptor becomes discontent, the student should send him away or have him sent away, or he should give him a teaching.
pli-tv-kd18:11.14.2: If the preceptor becomes anxious, the student should dispel it or have it dispelled, or he should give him a teaching.
pli-tv-kd18:11.14.3: If the preceptor has a wrong view, the student should make him give it up or have someone else do it, or he should give him a teaching.
pli-tv-kd18:11.15.1: If the preceptor has committed a heavy offense and deserves probation,
pli-tv-kd18:11.15.2: the student should try for the Sangha to get it done.
pli-tv-kd18:11.15.3: If the preceptor has committed a heavy offense and deserves to be sent back to the beginning,
pli-tv-kd18:11.15.4: the student should try for the Sangha to get it done.
pli-tv-kd18:11.15.5: If the preceptor has committed a heavy offense and deserves to be given the trial period,
pli-tv-kd18:11.15.6: the student should try for the Sangha to get it done.
pli-tv-kd18:11.15.7: If the preceptor has committed a heavy offense and deserves rehabilitation,
pli-tv-kd18:11.15.8: the student should try for the Sangha to get it done.
pli-tv-kd18:11.16.1: If the Sangha wants to do a legal procedure against his preceptor—whether a procedure of condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection—
pli-tv-kd18:11.16.2: the student should make an effort to stop it or to reduce the penalty.
pli-tv-kd18:11.16.3: But if the Sangha has already done a legal procedure against his preceptor—whether a procedure of condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection—
pli-tv-kd18:11.16.4: the student should help the preceptor conduct himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and try for the Sangha to lift that procedure.
pli-tv-kd18:11.17.1: “If the preceptor’s robe needs washing, the student should do it himself,
pli-tv-kd18:11.17.2: or he should make an effort to have it done.
pli-tv-kd18:11.17.3: If the preceptor needs a robe, the student should make one himself,
pli-tv-kd18:11.17.4: or he should make an effort to have one made.
pli-tv-kd18:11.17.5: If the preceptor needs dye, the student should make it himself,
pli-tv-kd18:11.17.6: or he should make an effort to have it made.
pli-tv-kd18:11.17.7: If the preceptor’s robe needs dyeing, the student should do it himself,
pli-tv-kd18:11.17.8: or he should make an effort to have it done.
pli-tv-kd18:11.17.9: When he’s dyeing the robe, he should carefully and repeatedly turn it over, and he shouldn’t go away while it’s still dripping.
pli-tv-kd18:11.18.1: Without asking permission of his preceptor, he should not do any of the following: give away or receive a bowl;
pli-tv-kd18:11.18.2: give away or receive a robe;
pli-tv-kd18:11.18.3: give away or receive a requisite;
pli-tv-kd18:11.18.4: cut anyone’s hair or have it cut;
pli-tv-kd18:11.18.5: do work for anyone or have work done by anyone;
pli-tv-kd18:11.18.6: do a service for anyone or have a service done by anyone;
pli-tv-kd18:11.18.7: be the attendant monk for anyone or take anyone as his attendant monk;
pli-tv-kd18:11.18.8: bring back almsfood for anyone or have almsfood brought back by anyone;
pli-tv-kd18:11.18.12: If his preceptor is sick, he should nurse him for as long as he lives, or he should wait until he has recovered.
pli-tv-kd18:11.18.13: This is the proper conduct of a student toward his preceptor.”
pli-tv-kd18:12.1.0: Discussion of the proper conduct toward a student

pli-tv-kd18:12.1.2: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd18:12.1.8: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-kd18:12.1.9: “Well then, I will lay down the proper conduct for preceptors toward their students.
pli-tv-kd18:12.2.1: A preceptor should conduct himself properly toward his student.

pli-tv-kd18:12.2.5: or he should make an effort to get him one.
pli-tv-kd18:12.2.6: If the preceptor has a robe, but not the student, the preceptor should give it to him,
pli-tv-kd18:12.2.7: or he should make an effort to get him one.
pli-tv-kd18:12.2.8: If the preceptor has a requisite, but not the student, the preceptor should give it to him,
pli-tv-kd18:12.2.9: or he should make an effort to get him one.
pli-tv-kd18:12.3.1: If the student is sick, the preceptor should get up at the appropriate time, and he should give his student a toothbrush and water for rinsing the mouth, and he should prepare a seat for him.

pli-tv-kd18:12.3.5: If the place is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd18:12.4.2: Before he’s due back, the preceptor should prepare a seat and set out a foot-stool, a foot-scraper, and water for washing the feet. He should go out to meet the student to receive his bowl and robe. He should give him a sarong and receive the one he’s wearing in return.
pli-tv-kd18:12.4.3: If the robe is moist, he should sun it for a short while, but he shouldn’t leave it in the heat.

pli-tv-kd18:12.6.3: if he wants a hot bath, he should prepare that.

pli-tv-kd18:12.11.183: “If the pupil wants to bathe, the teacher should prepare the bath.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.184: If he wants a cold bath, he should prepare that;
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.185: if he wants a hot bath, he should prepare that.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.186: If the pupil wants to use the sauna, the teacher should knead bath powder, moisten the clay, take the sauna stool, and go to the sauna. After giving the pupil the sauna stool, receiving his robe, and putting it aside, he should give him the bath powder and the clay.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.187: If he’s able, he should enter the sauna.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.188: When entering the sauna, he should smear his face with clay, cover himself in front and behind, and then enter the sauna.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.189: He shouldn’t sit encroaching on the senior monks,
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.190: and he shouldn’t block the junior monks from getting a seat.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.191: While in the sauna, he should do services for his pupil.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.192: When leaving the sauna, he should take the sauna stool, cover himself in front and behind, and then leave the sauna.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.193: The teacher should also do services for his pupil in the water.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.194: When the teacher has bathed, he should be the first to come out of the water. He should dry himself and put on his sarong. He should then wipe the water off his pupil’s body, and he should give him his sarong and then his upper robe. Taking the sauna stool, he should be the first to return. He should prepare a seat, as well as set out a foot-stool, a foot-scraper, and water for washing the feet. He should ask his pupil if he wants water to drink.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.195: “If the dwelling where the pupil is staying is dirty, the teacher should clean it if he’s able.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.196: When he’s cleaning the dwelling, he should first take out the bowl and robe and put them aside. He should take out the sitting mat and the sheet and put them aside. He should take out the mattress and the pillow and put them aside. Holding the bed low, he should carefully take it out without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it aside. Holding the bench low, he should carefully take it out without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it aside. He should take out the bed supports and put them aside. He should take out the spittoon and put it aside. He should take out the leaning board and put it aside. After taking note of where it’s placed, he should take out the floor-cover and put it aside. If the dwelling has cobwebs, he should first remove them from the ceiling cloth, and he should then sweep the windows and the corners of the room. If the walls have been treated with red ocher and they’re moldy, he should moisten a cloth, wring it out, and wipe the walls. If the ground has been treated with black and it’s moldy, he should moisten a cloth, wring it out, and wipe the floor. If the ground is untreated, he should sprinkle it with water and then sweep it, while trying to avoid stirring up dust. He should look out for any trash and discard it.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.197: He should sun the floor-cover, clean it, beat it, bring it back inside, and put it back in the same place as before. He should sun the bed supports, wipe them, bring them back inside, and place them in the same position as before. He should sun the bed, clean it, and beat it. Holding it low, he should carefully bring it back inside without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it back in the same place as before. He should sun the bench, clean it, and beat it. Holding it low, he should carefully bring it back inside without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it back in the same place as before. He should sun the mattress and the pillow, clean them, beat them, bring them back inside, and put them back the way they were. He should sun the sitting mat and the sheet, clean them, beat them, bring them back inside, and put them back the way they were. He should sun the spittoon, wipe it, bring it back inside, and put it back where it was. He should sun the reclining board, wipe it, bring it back inside, and put it back where it was. He should put away the bowl and robe. When putting away the bowl, he should hold the bowl in one hand, feel under the bed or the bench with the other, and then put it away. He should not put away the bowl on the bare ground. When putting away the robe, he should hold the robe in one hand, wipe the bamboo robe-rack or the clothesline with the other, and then put it away by folding the robe over it, making the ends face the wall and the fold face out.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.198: If dusty winds are blowing from the east, he should close the windows on the eastern side. If dusty winds are blowing from the west, he should close the windows on the western side. If dusty winds are blowing from the north, he should close the windows on the northern side. If dusty winds are blowing from the south, he should close the windows on the southern side. If the weather is cold, he should open the windows during the day and close them at night. If the weather is hot, he should close the windows during the day and open them at night.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.199: If the precincts are dirty, he should sweep them. If the gateway is dirty, he should sweep it. If the assembly hall is dirty, he should sweep it. If the water-boiling shed is dirty, he should sweep it. If the restroom is dirty, he should sweep it. If there is no water for drinking, he should set it out. If there is no water for washing, he should set it out.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.200: If there is no water in the rinsing pot, he should fill it.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.201: “If the pupil becomes discontent, the teacher should send him away or have him sent away, or he should give him a teaching.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.202: If the pupil becomes anxious, the teacher should dispel it or have it dispelled, or he should give him a teaching.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.203: If the pupil has a wrong view, the teacher should make him give it up or have someone else do it, or he should give him a teaching.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.204: If the pupil has committed a heavy offense and deserves probation,
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.205: the teacher should try for the Sangha to get it done.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.206: If the pupil has committed a heavy offense and deserves to be sent back to the beginning,
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.207: the teacher should try for the Sangha to get it done.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.208: If the pupil has committed a heavy offense and deserves to be given the trial period,
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.209: the teacher should try for the Sangha to get it done.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.210: If the pupil has committed a heavy offense and deserves rehabilitation,
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.211: the teacher should try for the Sangha to get it done.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.212: If the Sangha wants to do a legal procedure against his pupil—whether a procedure of condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection—
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.213: the teacher should make an effort to stop it or to reduce the penalty.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.214: But if the Sangha has already done a legal procedure against his pupil—whether a procedure of condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection—
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.215: the teacher should help the pupil conduct himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and try for the Sangha to lift that procedure.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.216: “If the pupil’s robe needs washing, the teacher should show him how to do it,
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.217: or he should make an effort to have it done.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.218: If the pupil needs a robe, the teacher should show him how to make one,
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.219: or he should make an effort to have one made.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.220: If the pupil needs dye, the teacher should show him how to make it,
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.221: or he should make an effort to have it made.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.222: If the pupil’s robe needs dyeing, the teacher should show him how to do it,
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.223: or he should make an effort to have it done.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.224: When he’s dyeing the robe, he should carefully and repeatedly turn it over,
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.225: and he shouldn’t go away while it’s still dripping.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.226: If his pupil is sick, he should nurse him for as long as he lives, or he should wait until he has recovered.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.227: This is the proper conduct of a teacher toward his pupil.”
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.228: The eighth chapter on proper conduct is finished. In this chapter there are nineteen topics and fourteen kinds of proper conduct.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.544: If you do not fulfill the proper conduct,
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.545: Then you do not fulfill your virtue.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.546: If your virtue is impure, you are weak in wisdom;
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.547: And you do not know the unity of mind.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.549: Does not see the truth of nature.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.550: Not seeing the truth of nature,
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.551: You are not released from suffering.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.552: But if you do fulfill the proper conduct,
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.553: Then you also fulfills your virtue.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.554: If your virtue is pure, you are possessed of wisdom;
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.555: And you know the unity of mind.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.561: you the Son of the Conqueror, possessed of insight.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.562: The instruction of the Buddha, the best—
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.563: Go from that to extinguishment, in this way.
pli-tv-kd18:12.11.564: The chapter on proper conduct is finished.
